other_tests.findings: Heterogeneous seminiferous tubules separated by fibrous tissue, few Leydig cells, half the tubuli were hyalinized or hypoplastic, immature Sertoli cells, and spermatogonia. Some tubules showed greatly reduced spermatogenesis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After 12 months of therapy with chorionic gonadotropin, testicular volume was 18.6 ml, testosterone secretion was maintained within the normal adult range, and the patient became oligospermic, although spermatozoa predominantly had abnormal shape and motility.

other_tests.findings: LH level remained undetectable; FSH rose from 8.7 to 10.7 mIU/ml at 60 min.
Serum testosterone increased from 0.49 to 4.32 ng/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Testosterone secretion was maintained within normal adult range after switching to chorionic gonadotropin treatment.
